definition[0]: above your head or in the sky
definition[1]: money spent regularly on rent, insurance, electricity, and other things that are needed to keep a business operating
example[2]: Their offices are in London so the overheads are very high.
definition[2]: a piece of transparent material used with an overhead projector to show words, pictures etc
definition[3]: a company’s general costs for activities not related to particular products
example[3]: Such costs count as an overhead of the business, and VAT on them is deductible.
example[4]: Because overhead costs won’t increase, profit margins at the hospital should expand.
example[5]: It spends about 17 cents to sell $1 of its goods, among the highest overheads in the tire industry.
example[6]: Firms have centralized buying to reduce both cost of goods and administrative overheads.
